alert.note: Alert for Clay; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 6:27PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Harlan, southwestern Letcher, Leslie, southeastern Perry, southwestern Knott and southeastern Clay Counties through 700 PM EST... At 626 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spring Creek, or 10 miles southwest of Hyden, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Essie around 630 PM EST. Hoskinston, Stinnett, Asher, Hosea, Chappell and Mozelle around 635 PM EST. Hyden, Cinda, Causey, Wendover and Napier around 640 PM EST. Cutshin, Daley, Yeaddiss, Smilax, Big Fork, Big Rock, Frew and Wooton around 645 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Leatherwood, Arthur, Diablock, Daisy, Cornettsville, Slemp, Viper, Jeff, Delphia, Letcher, Vicco, Blackey, Bluefield, Red Star, Ulvah, Arminta, Elko, Hallie and Gander. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry
